meanings.definition: Of poor quality or taste; inferior.
meanings.sent1: The old car looked even trashier next to the shiny new one.
meanings.sent2: The cheap knockoff purse was much trashier than the designer one.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations were so trashier that they made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her singing was like a trashier version of a cat yowling in the night.
meanings.sent5: The smell in the room was so trashier that it made my stomach turn.

meanings.definition: Characterized by being of low social status or lacking refinement.
meanings.sent1: The rundown neighborhood felt even trashier after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The reality TV show portrayed a trashier side of society.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a fancy dinner party ended up being even trashier than expected.
meanings.sent4: The gossip magazines always focus on the trashier aspects of celebrities' lives.
meanings.sent5: The old mansion had a certain trashier charm to it.

meanings.definition: To make something appear inferior or of poor quality.
meanings.sent1: She tried to trashier her competitor's reputation by spreading rumors.
meanings.sent2: The company's new ad campaign aimed to trashier their rival's products.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to trashier his friend's baking skills by bringing store-bought cookies.
meanings.sent4: The rival team attempted to trashier their opponents by questioning their sportsmanship.
meanings.sent5: The negative reviews online were meant to trashier the restaurant's image.
